intro: Dalechampia micromeria var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf dalechampia, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its alternate, narrow, and often hairy leaves that are typically lance-shaped. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually greenish-yellow in color. It is native to the southeastern United States and thrives in moist, wooded habitats. Its structure and growth pattern make it a distinctive species within its genus.
